ADAPTABILITY.1: Conduct retrospective meetings to assess what approaches were successful and which were not.
ADAPTABILITY.2: Attend cross-functional meetings to understand broader business dynamics.
ADAPTABILITY.3: Stay informed on industry trends to anticipate and prepare for changes.
ADAPTABILITY.4: Cultivate mental flexibility through grounding techniques like yoga, meditation, tai chi, exercise.
ADAPTABILITY.5: Embrace new technologies and methodologies quickly.
ADAPTABILITY.6: Regularly revise personal and team goals to align with changing company strategies.
ADAPTABILITY.7: Pay attention to the behaviors, speech, and values of others to tune-in to the situation.
ADAPTABILITY.8: Encourage team experimentation with new problem-solving techniques.
ADAPTABILITY.9: Journal with prompts related to seeing alternative perspectives. Ask yourself what others may be thinking and write from their perspective.
ADAPTABILITY.10: Encourage and reward flexibility and creativity within the team.

AGENT OF CHANGE.1: Communicate the benefits of change compellingly and clearly to your team and others.
AGENT OF CHANGE.2: Express thoughts and ideas openly in meetings.
AGENT OF CHANGE.3: Regularly solicit input and act on feedback.
AGENT OF CHANGE.4: Celebrate milestones and successes related to change initiatives.
AGENT OF CHANGE.5: Map out potential resistance points and develop strategies to address them.
AGENT OF CHANGE.6: Use data and case studies to demonstrate the success of proposed changes.
AGENT OF CHANGE.7: Develop small pilot programs to test changes before wide-scale implementation.
AGENT OF CHANGE.8: Identify early adopters within your team to help champion new initiatives.
AGENT OF CHANGE.9: Stay patient and persistent, recognizing that change takes time.
AGENT OF CHANGE.10: Build a network of change agents within and outside the organization for support and ideas.

BUILDING TEAMS.1: Foster a culture of open communication and collaboration.
BUILDING TEAMS.2: Hold regular 1-1 and team check-ins about how the team is doing.
BUILDING TEAMS.3: Define clear roles and responsibilities aligned with team members' strengths.
BUILDING TEAMS.4: Set shared goals that require collaboration to achieve.
BUILDING TEAMS.5: Address issues and concerns directly and promptly with individuals involved.
BUILDING TEAMS.6: Encourage the team to share successes and failures as learning opportunities.
BUILDING TEAMS.7: Regularly communicate how each project contributes to the company's mission.
BUILDING TEAMS.8: Seek to understand and leverage diverse perspectives on the team.
BUILDING TEAMS.9: Allocate time in meetings to share how your work impacts customers.
BUILDING TEAMS.10: Develop a charter that outlines the team's purpose, values, and behaviors expected from members.

COACHING.1: Conduct one-on-one meetings to discuss career goals and professional development.
COACHING.4: Set up a peer coaching program within the team.
COACHING.5: Use the GROW (Goal, Reality, Options, Will) model to structure coaching conversations.
COACHING.6: Encourage team members to reflect on their performance and identify areas for growth.
COACHING.7: Share articles, books, and resources relevant to team members' growth areas.
COACHING.8: Offer specific advice and strategies to overcome work challenges.
COACHING.9: Create individual development plans in partnership with team members.
COACHING.10: Engage with coaching best practices (listening without distractions, asking open-ended questions, reflecting back)

CREATING BUY-IN.1: Clearly articulate the vision and its importance to both the team and the company.
CREATING BUY-IN.2: Identify the people and groups you need to support your initiative and meet with them to get their input.
CREATING BUY-IN.3: Be willing to compromise and negotiate with stakeholders.
CREATING BUY-IN.4: Use storytelling to make the objectives more relatable and compelling.
CREATING BUY-IN.5: Identify and address individual concerns through one-on-one discussions.
CREATING BUY-IN.6: Invite input and incorporate feedback from the team to refine initiatives.
CREATING BUY-IN.7: Maintain consistent communication about progress and milestones.
CREATING BUY-IN.8: Be transparent about challenges while maintaining a positive outlook.
CREATING BUY-IN.9: Proactively build collaborative partnerships with key stakeholder groups and build trust before you need their support.
CREATING BUY-IN.10: Align incentives and rewards with desired outcomes to motivate team members.

DECISIVENESS.1: Start by determining what the decision making process will be.
DECISIVENESS.2: Define the desired outcomes when preparing to make a decision. Then evaluate options against the desired outcomes.
DECISIVENESS.3: Take steps to reduce confirmation bias: seek out disconfirming evidence and alternate points of view.
DECISIVENESS.4: Take steps to reduce overconfidence bias: how will we know if we are wrong? how can we prepare for that?
DECISIVENESS.5: Communicate decisions clearly along with the rationale behind them.
DECISIVENESS.6: Learn from past decisions by reviewing outcomes and processes.
DECISIVENESS.7: Balance intuition with data when making decisions.
DECISIVENESS.8: Delegate decision-making in areas where team members have more expertise.
DECISIVENESS.9: Set deadlines for decisions to avoid analysis paralysis.
DECISIVENESS.10: Gather sufficient information but recognize when it's time to move forward without full certainty.

DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.1: Assess individual team members' skills and delegate tasks that match their strengths.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.2: Clearly communicate expectations and desired outcomes when delegating.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.3: Provide the necessary resources and authority for team members to complete delegated tasks.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.4: Encourage autonomy while remaining available for guidance.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.5: Set up regular check-ins to monitor progress without micromanaging.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.6: Use delegation as a tool for developing team members' skills and careers.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.7: Give constructive feedback and recognize strong performance upon task completion.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.8: Trust your team's abilities and avoid the temptation to take back tasks.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.9: Foster a culture where team members feel empowered to take initiative.
DELEGATION AND EMPOWERMENT.10: Encourage team members to delegate within their own sub-teams.

DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.1: Map existing processes and identify areas for efficiency improvements.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.2: Involve team members in creating and refining new systems and processes.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.3: Define value in the 'eyes of the customer' for each process.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.4: Adopt a systems mindset, seeking to understand the interconnections between the parts.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.5: Pilot new processes on a small scale before company-wide implementation.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.6: Document processes clearly and ensure they are accessible to all relevant parties.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.7: Train the team on new systems and processes to ensure consistent understanding and execution.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.8: End each meeting with a summary of key decisions and clear action items with assigned owners.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.9: Create feedback loops within systems to enable continuous improvement.
DEVELOPING STRUCTURES, SYSTEMS, AND PROC.10: Balance the need for structure with the flexibility to accommodate unique scenarios.

EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.1: Set high standards for quality and clearly communicate these expectations.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.2: Lead by example by consistently delivering high-quality work.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.3: Recognize and celebrate work that exemplifies excellence.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.4: Regularly seek feedback on how to improve meeting effectiveness.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.5: Provide resources and training to enable high-quality outcomes.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.6: Constructively address subpar work and offer support for improvement.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.7: Challenge the team to exceed industry standards and innovate.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.8: Facilitate a culture of continuous learning and professional development.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.9: Regularly review team outputs to ensure they meet quality standards.
EMPHASIZING EXCELLENCE.10: Incorporate excellence into performance metrics and reviews.

FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.1: Encourage open communication to address issues before they escalate.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.2: Act as a neutral mediator during conflicts to facilitate fair resolutions.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.3: Foster an environment where different viewpoints are respected and valued.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.4: Train in conflict resolution techniques to handle disputes effectively.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.5: Regularly check in with team members to proactively identify and resolve tensions.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.6: Encourage team members to resolve conflicts among themselves before escalating.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.7: Use role-playing exercises to prepare for and practice conflict resolution.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.8: Keep a record of conflicts and resolutions to identify patterns and improve future responses.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.9: Provide a safe space for team members to express grievances.
FACILITATING CONFLICT RESOLUTION.10: Implement a clear policy for managing conflicts that align with company values.

FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.1: Attend meetups and industry conferences to network with potential candidates.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.2: Foster internships and partnerships with universities to build a talent pipeline.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.3: Create a compelling employer brand story to share on social media and career pages.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.4: Implement a structured interview process that highlights growth opportunities.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.5: Build a diverse and inclusive work environment to attract a wider range of candidates.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.6: Offer a referral bonus to current employees for successful hires.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.7: Host open house events or talks to showcase your company culture.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.8: Showcase your company’s work and projects to attract talent interested in doing that work.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.9: Develop a competitive benefits package that includes unique perks and professional development opportunities.
FINDING AND ATTRACTING TALENT.10: Utilize professional networking platforms to headhunt and connect with talent.

HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.1: Set clear and measurable goals in a collaborative manner with each team member.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.2: Provide regular feedback to team members, both praise and constructive feedback.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.3: Provide regular coaching through asking questions and helping team members strengthen problem solving mindsets.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.4: Hold debriefs after major decisions or events to learn from them.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.5: Delegate tasks with clear ownership and deadlines.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.6: Follow up on delegated tasks to ensure progress and offer support.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.7: Hold regular one-on-one meetings with each team member to review progress and provide support.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.8: Use project management tools to monitor task completion and provide visibility to the team.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.9: Conduct regular performance reviews to discuss progress and areas for improvement.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE.10: Address underperformance promptly and constructively, with a plan for improvement.

INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.1: Demonstrate a strong work ethic and commitment to quality.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.2: Share yourself with your team, being open about personal stories and challenges.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.3: Exhibit enthusiasm and passion for your work and the company's mission.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.4: Display a positive attitude even in the face of setbacks.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.5: Lead by example in maintaining a healthy work-life balance.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.6: Show appreciation for hard work and dedication openly.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.7: Continuously work on your professional development and share your learnings.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.8: Treat everyone with respect and fairness, regardless of their position.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.9: Demonstrate the values and behaviors you wish to see in your team.
INSPIRATIONAL ROLE MODEL.10: Be consistent in your speech, actions, and decisions.

LISTENING.2: Encourage team members to share their ideas and truly consider them.
LISTENING.3: Regularly ask for feedback on your management style and decisions.
LISTENING.4: Ask open-ended questions to understand the perspective of others fully.
LISTENING.5: Hold regular one-on-one meetings to understand individual concerns and suggestions.
LISTENING.6: Provide your full attention during discussions, avoiding distractions like checking emails.
LISTENING.7: Reflect back what you've heard to ensure understanding and show that you are listening.
LISTENING.8: Recognize and acknowledge the feelings behind the words, not just the words themselves.
LISTENING.9: Keep an open-door policy where team members feel comfortable coming to you.
LISTENING.10: Follow up on discussions to show you have taken to heart what was said.

PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.1: Set annual and quarterly goals using a goal-setting system (e.g. OKRs).
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.2: Begin each week with clear goals and objectives.
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.3: Conduct regular team meetings to review progress toward goals.
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.4: Break down large projects into manageable milestones.
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.5: Ensure goals are specific and measurable with clear owners.
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.6: Limit the number of active projects to avoid overextension.
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.7: Keep purpose in mind in meetings. Respectfully redirect if getting off topic or less relevant to the group.
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.8: Coach the team around prioritization and time management techniques to improve effectiveness.
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.9: Create focused work periods with no meetings to allow for deep work.
PLANNING, PRIORITIZING, AND MAINTAINING.10: Set realistic deadlines and help your team manage their workload to meet them.

PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.1: Give praise to team members that is specific.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.2: Give praise to team members in a timely manner.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.3: Appreciate small acts as well as major achievements.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.4: Recognize the effort as much as the outcome.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.5: Provide praise mostly in a one-on-one context.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.6: Provide praise more frequently than constructive feedback.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.7: Praise learning moments as helpful in working toward quality outcomes.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.8: Share praise in all directions, to your supervisor, your peers, and any people you manage.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.9: Encourage team members to share praise with each other to identify what is working and build upon it.
PRAISE AND RECOGNITION.10: Write personalized thank-you notes for outstanding effort.

RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.1: Promote a healthy work-life balance within your team.
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.2: Encourage regular breaks and time off to prevent burnout.
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.3: Offer flexible working hours to accommodate personal needs.
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.4: Lead by example by managing your stress in a healthy way.
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.5: Regularly check in with team members about their workload and stress levels.
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.6: Create a supportive environment where team members can talk about their stressors.
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.7: Introduce relaxation areas, classes, or activities in the workplace.
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.8: Encourage physical activity (e.g., organize team fitness challenges, team exercise outings).
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.9: Host workshops on stress management techniques (yoga, meditation, tai chi).
RESILIENCE AND STRESS MANAGEMENT.10: Journal using prompts related to resilience.

STRATEGIC FOCUS.1: Develop a clear and coherent strategy.
STRATEGIC FOCUS.2: Make sure team objectives are highly aligned with the company’s strategic priorities.
STRATEGIC FOCUS.3: Focus on the highest priorities and set aside less critical tasks.
STRATEGIC FOCUS.4: Articulate key strategic questions and allocate time to discuss them.
STRATEGIC FOCUS.5: Conduct strategy reviews regularly (e.g., Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats).
STRATEGIC FOCUS.6: Ensure that resources – time, budget, personnel – are allocated in a way that supports the most strategically important projects and initiatives.
STRATEGIC FOCUS.7: Regularly review and communicate the strategic plan to ensure alignment.
STRATEGIC FOCUS.8: Use data and analysis to inform strategic decisions.
STRATEGIC FOCUS.9: Allocate time at least monthly for the team to do bigger picture strategy work.
STRATEGIC FOCUS.10: Encourage the team to think about the long-term impact of their work.
